DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate effect one week high versus low glycaemic index dietary intervention hepatic glycogen lipid level blood hormone level two way cross over study see correlation satiety appetite .
DOC.brief_title: Investigating Effects High GI Versus Low GI Diet Hepatic Metabolism Satiety Levels Healthy Subjects
DOC.detailed_description: 8 Healthy subject scan start end 7 day high versus low glycaemic diet 4 week washout arm . During scan day hepatic glycogen response correspond high versus low glycaemic index test meal measure use 13C Magnetic resonance spectroscopy ( MRS ) explore acute change metabolic response . Baseline liver lipid level measure use 1H MRS explore long term change liver lipid level . Blood sample also obtain throughout test day measure blood glucose , insulin blood hormone response . Satiety survey also take throughout test day diet week . The main hypothesis one week calorie match Glycaemic index vary diet result alter response liver glycogen level acutely follow meal also long term hepatic liver lipid level . A secondary hypothesis also associate change blood sugar hormone level change effect satiety level subject .
DOC.criteria: Male Caucasian Selfreported nonathletic healthy : carry strenuous exercise ( high sweat , breath , high heart rate activity le 2 hour moderate exercise week ) , moderate drinker ( less 3 unit day ) , smoker Routinely eat 3 meal day Stable weight Age ≥ 18 ≤ 35 Body mass index ( BMI weight / square height ) ≥ 20.0 ≤ 27.0 kg/m2 Suitable MRI scanning ( e.g. , absence metal implant , infusion pump pacemaker ) assess attach MRI safety questionnaire . Suitable blood sample cannula insertion ( e.g. , aversion needle ) Willing follow prescribe diet plan Not take concurrent medication No diabetic metabolic disorder ( e.g . insulin resistance , thyroid dysfunction ) No volunteer liver disease No clot disorder No Participation another nutritional biomedical trial 3 month prestudy examination study . No use medically selfprescribed diet moment prestudy examination till end study Taking prescription medication drug may influence liver function glucose energy metabolism . Any allergy food intolerance Unsuitable MR scanning ( i.e . pacemaker and/or medical implant ) The subject employee Unilever site conduct study .
